metadata.title: CVE-2016-0736 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0 to 2.4.23, mod_session_crypto wasencrypting its data/cookie using the configured ciphers with possiblyeither CBC or ECB modes of operation (AES256-CBC by default), hence noselectable or builtin authenticated encryption. This made it vulnerable topadding oracle attacks, particularly with CBC.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0736` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2').
